website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for customers seeking a versatile stand to hold their small earbuds or larger headphones.
pros: Top headphone rest is made of soft, bent silicone to prevent scratching or creasing
Frame made of steel to provide a solid, durable hold
Includes a cable holder at the base offering clean look with simple storage
cons: Silicone base could be thicker, according to a few customers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stand
customer_reviews.text: I was looking through Amazon for a perfect headphone stand for my very valuable headphones, and this is it. Other ones have flaws here and there with the design but this one is perfect. It doesn't ruin the top padded part of the headphones, and have a convenient tray for cable. The size is perfect too as long as your headphones are not enormous. I bought a second stand as soon as I opened the first one. The picture shows my two headphones on the stand: Sennheiser HD 800s and Sennheiser GAME ZERO. Both headbands are not pushed all the way in, so the stand should be able to hold much bigger headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mela

customer_reviews.title: Best headset stand!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best headset stand I have found thus far. It could be a bit heavier but it’s heavy enough to prevent it from moving/tipping when grabbing your headset from it. My favorite part is the headband rest. IT IS PERFECT!!! Unlike every other headset stand that creeses the headband this one offers a curved, silicone headband rest that allows the headset to sit without putting pressure on your headset. I’ve tested it with various headsets for different amounts of hours and it was a perfect fit for all. Definitely will be buying multiples of this headset stand to accommodate all my headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia B

customer_reviews.title: Too short for larger, high-end headphones
customer_reviews.text: I got this thing to hold some high-end headphones, ZMF Atticus and/or Sennheiser HD800/650/600 (yes, I have too many headphones). It is too short to hold any of these without taking the cables off (which I don't want to do every time) since the cable connectors don't clear the bottom tray. Rather than send it back and get something larger, I decided to take it into my office with me where it holds my ZMF Classics with plenty of clearance... but the headband on the Classics is too large to fit around the rubber groove in the top. The quality is okay, I feel like the rubber parts are prone to coming loose from the metal fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: not sure id buy any other headset stand
customer_reviews.text: So assembly was a snap, packaging was high quality and simple. Materials your looking at matte finish rubber or silicone not sure on the base and top with painted metal on the L stand. Thread the rubber disc through the metal stand and snap the top on and thats it. The base is like a large ashtray so you can put stuff in it with a high lip to keep whatever you put in there from rolling out. Very stable simple and elegant. 5 stars on the stand as a whole. If your debating which headset stand to get this one is legit. I would not hesitate to suggest buying this.
customer_reviews.author: stuff

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect, but this seems to be a good stand. The rest and base are silicone. Which for the base, it seemed rather odd. But because it is silicon instead of a hard plastic, I can only assumed that is done to keep cost done. The headphone rest is silicone too. It's perfect. It folders the contour of the head band resulting in not having an indent in the middle of the Bottom of the head band like other stands leave. Overall this is a good product. It looks great and I am using it to display an old headset that I had boxed in a closet.
customer_reviews.author: A. CabreraTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable headphones with great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Discovering that these headphones have to be linked to the internet and television set made my better half, a computerphobe, rather grumpy. Fortunately, our son came over and within five minutes had everything synced and all ready to go. While these are excellent once you get them working, a warning or perhaps someone stored in the box should be provided for computerphobes. Having tried lots of different headphones over the years, these are by far my husband's favorite when it comes to sound and comfort. Highly recommend them if you have a young child or teen at home, are computer/internet literate, or can bribe someone to help.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the headband rest material. I feel like putting a nice expensive pair of cans on these won't have any effect on the headbands. The bottom tray is really nice for cable management, when you get the chance to wind it up. I'd totally buy an auto-winder! Haha. The pad on the bottom is slippery/not grippy, can be easily replaced, but just something to note. I'd like to see it more of a grippy material to keep the stand where I put it. Hard to beat for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Clean headset stand
customer_reviews.text: Very simple & clean, and I like the little "dish" area at the bottom (I put my Galaxy Buds down there). Some other users have mentioned that the rubbery bottom area doesn't lie completely flat (which was the case for me) due to it being raised in the front a little bit. This is a super easy fix. There's a notch on the underside of the front of the rubbery part, which seems to not be cut deep enough. I took my pocket knife and knocked it out a TINY bit more and now it lays completely flat.
customer_reviews.author: John Gray

customer_reviews.title: so useful!
customer_reviews.text: I know it seems a simple thing - a place to hang your headset, but this has truly helped me so much. It saves so much space being able to drop my wireless headset on it for charging between uses. It has a nice area underneath for me to store some earbuds or other things, too. It's sturdy, lightweight, and space-saving. My headphones fit like a glove on it, and I can wrap a USB charging cable around the stand so it doesn't fall behind my desk between charges.
customer_reviews.author: Ramze

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit apprehensive when I saw the base was rather floppy rubber, but the heavy gauge metal upright member turned under to reinforce it nicely and add weight to the base. Photos of it make the upright appear to be metallic grey (lighter than base & top member), but mine is painted black. This is fine by me and not totally unexpected from experience. Looks clean and is very stable. Holds My RIG wireless set perfectly, and matches my decor while doing it. The rubber base is probably going to be a dust magnet, but can be easily removed and rinsed off.
customer_reviews.author: RO

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking but need to be careful with lifting your headset
customer_reviews.text: It looks cool and does the job BUT the design could be better. Well, there are designs out there that is better. Not sure what made me went with this one. So the reason for subtracting the 1 star is that you have to carefully left your headset up and pull towards you. lift too high, the ear pieces pulls the mount, lift too low and it is still on the hook. So you have to go slow.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: High quality and nice matte black finish.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy aluminum headphone stand. The stand looks great and had a nice rubber cup for a corded headset or adapters. Read the directions as it’s a little wonky to put together. The finish is a very nice matte black that puts the emphasis on the headphones and not the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Brower

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, well built and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The "Avantree Aluminum PC Gaming Headset Headphone Stand Hanger with Cable Holder" goes very well with my Bose Quiet Comfort 35 headphones. They look like they belong together and their styles match nicely. They look great together on my desk too. The curve of the headphone support perfectly matches the padded headband of my headphones so it isn't going leave a dent in the padding. This stand is very sturdy and stable so it won't tip over from the weight of the headphones. The materials are excellent quality and should never break or wear. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weed

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphone hanger for my Sennheiser GSP 302 headset!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Solid build + Simple to put together (took maybe 30 seconds) + Space for a cord to be placed (or in my case, rechargeable batteries for my mouse!) + Nice rubber bowl and hanger + Sturdy metal base Cons: - Rubber isn't siting perfectly down - Was a little finicky to get out of the packaging I'm really finding it hard to find some sort of negatives, this really is a great product with hardly any negatives. This is great for those who have room on their desk, and for those like me who can't put a c-clamp hanger along the sides of their desk. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand, the way it looks and how sturdy it is. I bought these because I wanted a curved top piece for my headphones to rest so I could avoid leaving any marks on the headband foam. I was pleasantly surprised how sleek the plastic pieces of this stand look, and the metal bar is solid and substantial for it's size. My headphones will not slip off of this, nor will this stand tip over with any ease. It's also cool to have a little tray at the base to put stuff in like my spare cables or what not.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my G230 Logitech Headphones that has a very long cable. The cable sits nice and tucked away at the base. The rubber material feels nice to touch and the steel frame adds weight to keep it up right. I wish the part at the top had some kind of grip to hold the headphones in place, as it is you just kinda place it there and balance. It only has maybe an inch of separation between the headphones bottom and base, so maybe it wont work on bigger headphones Overall I like the addition to my pc table.
customer_reviews.author: Jasko

customer_reviews.title: It just works, and well at that!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the stand for my new Sony WH-1000X M3 Headphones. It holds them securely. The top is a nice material to protect the headphone padding, has a curve that fully supports the bend, and gentle separation of the cups is all that is needed to place them on the stand. No obnoxious company name or logo, just 5 petal leafs in the base, nice. I may field modify the angle of the base and top by a few degrees each, my choice. The base is narrowish as others have pointed out. After 5 days of use I have not even rocked the stand, a non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: T. Call

customer_reviews.title: Take care not to damage box
customer_reviews.text: Good headphone stand. You could probably figure out how to assemble it without directions, but if you want to avoid figuring it out for yourself be careful not to damage outside edge of the box as that is the only instructions (nothing inside). Very simple assembly, but if you don't find such things intuitive it might take you an extra couple of minutes without the (reasonably clear) directions.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Guy

customer_reviews.title: Needs more value for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Once put together and set up with headphones on it the stand looks pretty nice. I was expecting a base already attached to this thing, however what they give you are 2 pieces of silicone one for the rest on top, the other for the wire holder base on the bottom. The bottom slides over the metal neck and you shove the silicone part into the groove. The top is similar with some double sided tape to keep it attached. For the price Would have loved to have seen a plastic base and top. Can't complain too much though it's doing it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Joey K

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my SHP9500 headphones. Specially for the price. The only issue I had with this item is cable management. If you have a long cable, or even slightly on the stiff side, this thing will do nothing but frustrate you. Other than that, it's exactly what I expected it to be. In fact it's better. I thought it might be flimsy due to the material, but it isn't at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. I've recently started using headsets as to not ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I've recently started using headsets as to not wake anyone up when I game since I only have time before bed :(. I have never considered getting a stand for the headset until I started realizing how messy it made my desk look. It is a little pricier than it likely costs to make but it looks very nice. The base is also not has heavy as I'd preferred it to be. It will easily flip over or fall off the table if you happen to tug on the headset wire. I might just sticky it on the table to resolve that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Solid stand, does the trick, but minor usability issue
customer_reviews.text: The curve on the headphone mount itself is nice; it is sturdy and secure. The only gripe I have with it is that the rubber base doesn't fit very well onto the metal stand, making it feel a little awkward to use/place. I would recommend if this is the price range you're looking for, but personally I would spend a few more bucks in the future to get a better stand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for not ruining Bluetooth Bose headband
customer_reviews.text: Good stand. It's well made and designed. I'm not sure what people are talking about with issues that are common in reviews here like the rest popping off, obviously they didn't put it together properly. I didn't even use the tape that comes with and i don't have that issue. It fits my Bluetooth over ear Bose great, it's contoured perfectly so as not to dimple the center of the headband like the $50 just mobile stand i also own. It's stable and you have the bottom area to store whatever. Definitely grab one of these!
customer_reviews.author: jme

customer_reviews.title: Avantree Headphone Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is my third headphone stand from Avantree. There are certainly many to choose from and many will hang my headphones, but I do like the recessed base that stores the cable. Not all of them do that. I just got the HIFI Man HE 400i phones that have a very wide head strap about 3 inches; wide. The top holder of the Avantree only juts out about 2 inches; so the strap pushes against the upright arm. No problem. I just slide the headphones slightly to the side so the headphone strap is narrower where it contacts the arm. It's a very good stand.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Good Weight & Well Executed
customer_reviews.text: This stand comes in 3 parts. The soft rubber base and semi-soft top, and then the frame. The frame is nice and heavy and is coated in something. It basically looks and feels very high quality. The top is also sturdy and feels high quality. The base is just ok. I think this looks really nice overall, but the base will probably be a bit of a dust magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Musser

customer_reviews.title: Box was missing the most important component...  The metal stand!
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful for this stand since it had such awesome reviews from others, but unfortunately the box was missing the metal stand! The two other rubber pieces seemed like good quality, but I had to send the box back since it was incomplete... Not sure if I will re-order since I have found so many other less expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Simple, elegant, stable.
customer_reviews.text: The stand looks elegant, the design is simple, and it works exactly as it should with great stability without having to stick it down or screw it in. The brushed metal feels nice, the rubber is high quality, and even the packaging materials are recycle-friendly. Honestly, if you're looking for a headphone stand, just stop and get this.
customer_reviews.author: Tango-Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, a little better than basic
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent headphone stand. I'm using this for Jabra 85h headphones. These headphones are weird in that in order to turn them off, I have to flip the earcups back so a normal headphone stand wouldn't work. These work quite well and fit my headphones well. Only thing that was a bit of a bummer is the bottom tray piece. It's all silicone so it's a little wobbly. I thought it would be a sturdier piece of plastic. There's no issue with balance or anything but this is just more of a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: LouRevue

customer_reviews.title: Holds a usb headset used for web meetings very well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife now that she has had to work from home for a while and just wanted a better way to store her headset when not in use. It is very sturdy , easy to assemble and doesn't move around on the desk. Simply it works well. The materials look like they will stand up to the test of time. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: Holds my SteelSeries Arctis 7 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand, it has good materials and to improve it's stability, I used some double sided tape to attach the rubber base to the stand. That small modification made it even more stable and is something I would think the manufacturer should provide.
customer_reviews.author: J. Matcuk

customer_reviews.title: Falls over constantly
customer_reviews.text: Based on the large number of positives reviews I had thought this would be an easy successful purchase. However, what wasn't clear to me from reading the reviews is that the base is just a piece of rubber that lays on top of a relatively thin piece of metal. As such, it constantly falls over at the slightest bump and the base routinely works itself free of the stand needing to be put back into it's place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't think twice...just get it!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second stand that I've purchased. I bought my first one a little over a year ago for my Logitech g933s that I use with my PC and it wound up being the perfect stand. The curve of the rubber where the headset rests is perfect and allows your headset to rest without leaving any marks or indentations. So when I recently got my LucidSound LS35x for my Xbox I didn't hesitate to buy a second one. Do it, your headset will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JamesS

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and plenty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: There isn't much too a headphone stand, but this has all the features you would want....for example, it holds your headphones. It's balanced nicely and no worries about my headphones. The silicon (??) parts are molded nicely and seem of sturdy quality. The metal stand has a nice padded bottom so you don't scratch the desk. It looks nice. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Fit's the cord well....perfect hanger
customer_reviews.text: So I use a coat rack actually to hang my collection of headphones. Most of which I've bought on Amazon. The prices are the best. This little rack sits next to my amp/dac on my desk and carries the headphone I'm enjoying the most at the moment. The cord winds up and sits in the tray nicely.....enjoy
customer_reviews.author: M. KIRK

customer_reviews.title: Great overall quality.
customer_reviews.text: these are simple, but work perfectly. I paired them with a set of Philips open-back headphones and the fit is great. the . The built-in cable holder/tray is great for extra cables or other small items. They are sturdy and have never fallen over after several weeks of use. I believe these or any stand hanger will increase the life expectancy of any headphone you own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks clean and hold my headphones!
customer_reviews.text: My desk is cleaner with this bad boy here to help me out. At first I didn't want to purchase this because of the logo on the base.. i know I'm weird but it's what made me hesitate. I don't notice the logo at all and never see it so theres that. But it's sharp, makes my desk look clean and professional and that's pretty much the point of the product. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not as hogh end as expected
customer_reviews.text: While the product is aesthetically pleasing I felt that having the base and the holder be soft rubber made it a little weak, so far it has held my headphones quite well (astro a40) but it did not give me the impression of a high end stand that it gives in the pics. As for quality I would say it is a little below of what I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: El Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Holds my wig
customer_reviews.text: Using this to hold a costume wig because I found it creepy to put on a head form. It does a great job and it's also great at holding headphones. The base is very sturdy and the materials are high quality. You can store little accessories or cords in the base so space is not wasted. I'm using it to hold wig caps.
customer_reviews.author: Signatore

customer_reviews.title: Good Design
customer_reviews.text: First I watched a video by Linus Tech Tips showing submissions of 3D printed headphone stand designs. That made it perfectly clear to me what I should look for. This stand is it. My Sennheiser HD600 headphones rest without confining the wires. The shape seems unlikely to deform the foam in the headband. It looks nice. It doesn't really wobble but your cat might be able to knock it over. I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Wonky

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, and is pretty sexy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my desk at the office, that way I can plug in for power when I leave. My Sennheiser Headphones sit on it perfect, and my USB charging cable runs from my office into the headphones. Easy to hook up every night and my headphones are fully-charged in the AM. Very good looking and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harper

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It works really well the only issue that I'm having with the overall structure is the base is not well down enough so they could tip over on its own does a base is only a metal plate that goes through the middle and the rest of the circular shape is just rubber it's not till Sunday but you can still feel if you put a pretty heavy headset or headphones not well centered it will tip over
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Z

customer_reviews.title: Good, but room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I so far like this stand, but there’s a couple things that could be improved. The rubber Matt doesn’t sit flush with my desk, it’s propped up in the front on both of mine, I made sure it’s set in properly, but it’s still not perfect. Second, a hole on the back to put a charging wire through for wireless headphones would be very handy. Took me 5 minutes to realize this, why haven’t they?
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: The bottom of the base is a flexible silicone and doesn't quite like having all of its edge flat with the desk
customer_reviews.text: the top black rest is curved on the bottom side, while the top of the metal that it is supposed to join to is flat. Even the 3M adhesive couldn't keep it from constantly shifting and eventually loosing its ability to stay on. The bottom of the base is a flexible silicone and doesn't quite like having all of its edge flat with the desk. Also, good luck ever getting your wire to look like it does in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Ed the Nerd

customer_reviews.title: The cord for my Sennheiser HD650 is pretty long, which I like
customer_reviews.text: The cord for my Sennheiser HD650 is pretty long, which I like, but it can be a bit of a tangled mess on my desk where I keep it. I bought the Avantree stand to help straighten up, tidy up, and better protect my investment in such high quality headphones, and it really does the job. It looks so much nicer, and with the long cord, makes it easier to get the headphones. It looks classy, and should last a lifetime. Just what I needed, and I would highly recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Northern VA

customer_reviews.title: Really?  Super Misleading Description!
customer_reviews.text: OK, so the title of this product is plain and simple misleading. It is not Solid Steel. Everything you see that is darker is a very thin rubber. The base and the part that hold the headphones up top are rubber covered steel. It does not feel premium at all. From an aesthetics standpoint, it looks nice. Just leave it in place and don't move it around a lot and you'll be fine. But they know they are misleading people and it says a lot about character, or lack thereof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy is reliable... And if it doesn't work you can always hit them with it.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a few headphone stands at this point and I'm glad that this one is mostly made out of metal. I'm hoping that this means that it won't break or fall apart now. There shouldn't be anything on it to break. It's basically a metal arm that is also the base and two silicone pieces that hold the headphones and the cable. I Just wish they'd made the neck about an inch longer because my large headphones are almost sitting in the cable tray when they're on it. When all is said and done I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Solid and affordable
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see that it wasn't all metal but was also happy about it. The actual frame is metal and the hanger and base are rubber materials. It snaps on easily to the frame and the rubber material is actually much better - hold the headphones well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tech support was very helpful and shipping was fast
customer_reviews.text: It came in fast easy to put together looks good wish it was bit taller kind of to short for my DT 770 pro. Update Luffy Li Avantree Support Desk was very helpful in shipping The Bamboo Headphone stand which is tall than the solid steel stand both stands are beautiful and have great build quality. Now my DT 770 pro feel at home on the Bamboo headstand which looks very sexy. Im very happy with my purchases and would recommend both stands for your headphones stand needs. Avantree Universal Solid Steel Headphone Stand Avantree Bamboo headphone stand
customer_reviews.author: Rafael M.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The stand arrives in three pieces. The base, which is a flexible rubber, the stem, which is metal (aluminium) and the resting post which is a stiffer type of rubber. The base slips onto the metal and the resting post snaps onto the top of the metal post. Assembled in less than 1 minute. The entire footprint of the stand takes up less space than if you were to simply lay the headphones on their side. Attractive, well-made, practical.
customer_reviews.author: The Buddhist Witch

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality with metal and silicon construction. Looks sharp sitting on my desk with my nice headphones. The cord tray is a nice touch and keeps your tabletop orderly. Will strongly consider other Avantree products in the future based on this purchase. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Reece

customer_reviews.title: Well designed.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, works well for headphones made by the same company. Solid, doesn't tip and well organized to keep your stuff organized. Will be purchasing another for my other headphones. Used with: ] and the less expensive version of this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: CTYankee9

customer_reviews.title: "Stable" enough for me...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what others are expecting when they say this isn't stable. A solid 1-lb piece of aluminum? Stop tossing the headphones on it? The base might creep a few mm as you use it over a few days. This holds my headphones well, doesn't scratch it, is high enough, and most importanly doesn't leave a pressure spot on the headphone's padding when it sits for a few days. The base also holds your keys, usb card, whatever as a bonus
customer_reviews.author: Chef_Nasty

customer_reviews.title: Useful!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great! It keeps my wireless headphones safe from damaging situations it may otherwise land in without it, and it even has a little tray where I keep the charging cord, the wireless USB connecter, and even my wireless mouse when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for my gaming headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this thing! Very sturdy, good quality, looks premium and very easy to put together or take apart for whatever reason. The top piece that hold the headphones has good grip and it’s covered in a piece of smooth rubber that protects them from getting scratches. Love the fact that the bottom has like a tray where you can store little things like memory sticks or charging cable etc.. If you are pleased with how it looks then GO FOR IT! You’ll be even happier when you see it and feel it person 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Claudiu C.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: After searching for a headphone stand for my Bose QC 25's I finally settled on this one because of the price. The long "neck" part of the stand is heavy metal, but the silicone rubber material on the base and the part that your headphones actually hang on is lightweight which makes the stand fall over easily. It looks ok but does not feel very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Tia M.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting...
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this thing and the Tag line of "Solid Steel", I was expecting this thing whole thing to be made of "Solid Steel"... but it isn't. The only metal part is the neck piece. The bottom tray is made of a thin, silicone type material and so it the cradle part on top. I was expecting a soild piece to put my headphones on and what I got was NOTHING like what I envisioned. Does it still support my headphones? Yes. For that it merits 3 stars. And it loses 2 stars for a slightly misleading headline.
customer_reviews.author: Eratix

customer_reviews.title: Solid Headphone Holder
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and is great for holding my headphones. The cord never looks as pretty as it does in the attached pictures unless you want to take five minutes to roll it up every time you hang up your headphones, but that's not the product's fault. The base / setup seemed a little flimsy, its basically just rubber pieces slotted over metal and tends to fall off / apart when moved. But given that it remains mostly static, this is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for the intended use and a few others.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Steelseries Siberia 800 headset for gaming and wanted a stand to keep them from just laying on my desk or draped over my monitors. It works exactly how I want and I do like the way it looks as well. Very simple design but very nice as well. The rubber is grippy (is that a word?) and I've had no issues with the headset getting knocked off due to sliding.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: The feel is a little weird due to the thin rubber of the circular material at the bottom. The part that holds the headphone is excellent, the curve is perfect to maintain the curve on your headband. The base fits an Echo Dot with Clock perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: RedOneStandingBy

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Holds headphones up nice. Simple to put together, not much else to say. The bottom piece isn't attached btw, it's a piece of rubber you have to finagle on the metal bottom, which is a narrow bar coming towards you. Awkward design, but you won't notice nor care once it's put together and saddled with headphones.
customer_reviews.author: TooTired

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand feels very sturdy and it's heavy too which is good since it won't topple over whenever I remove my headphones. I use it to hold my Sony XB550AP and it does so without problems. The plate on the base is a plus for holding wires too. As reference, my Logitech G430 (gaming headphones) and my old Bose QuietComfort 3's can easily sit on it without issues as well. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: raerae

customer_reviews.title: Good enough. Cheap enough.
customer_reviews.text: It works for my Sennheiser HD599. The rubber likes to attract dust and is a bit hard to clean, though. As stated in other reviews, the part that actually acts as the stand is the metal bar that attaches to the rubber part. It's easy to assemble, as there are only three parts: the metal bar/stand, the bottom rubber part for holding different things, and the top rubber part to distribute the weight across a wide area of the headband so the stand doesn't leave an imprint.
customer_reviews.author: Link113

customer_reviews.title: The good point of this stand is of good quality and an cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: 1. The good point of this stand is of good quality and an cheap price. 2. I'm using a wireless headset. But wireless headsets also have a cable for charging, this stand has a cable holder that makes keep so good. 3. Unfortunately, the bottom part it looks cheap because rubber. But it is black so you don't feel rubber if you don't look closely.
customer_reviews.author: Koo_C

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like this stand. It's too flimsy and was getting knocked over almost daily just from taking the headphones on and off. Dont think it's worth $20 either, maybe $10. I just bought their bamboo stand and prefer it much better. It's sturdier and cheaper. Would recommend that one instead. I brought this pair to work so it wasn't a waste, but wouldn't recommend it and wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John Y

customer_reviews.title: not a great base
customer_reviews.text: the base is silicon? or some other soft material. this limits its stability. it tends to want to tip when you put the headphones on a certain way changing this to a harder material, coated iin silicone would be much better other than that it works ok
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Simple Design, But Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfected form of a simple design. I just recently purchased an expensive wireless headset for when I'm gaming, and needed a place for them to sit instead of hung off the back of my chair as I did with my old pair. This looks great, won't damage my headset when hung up, and the tray on the base is great to help organize my desk a bit more. Less loose bits roaming about!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn LedgerTop Contributor: Japanese Food

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Headphone Stand
customer_reviews.text: I needed a solid stand for my headphones that would not press on the earcups. The Avantree Headset Hanger is just right. It isn't fussy, it is very solid and unobtrusive. I put it together in about 30 seconds. An excellent value and a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: Stand offers a place for the headphones and the wires.
customer_reviews.text: There was no assembly required. The stand looks great next to the TV. I love that there’s a place to put away the headphones. Stylish and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand
customer_reviews.text: Most important part is it's one piece, I've ordered two other headphone stands on amazon that failed to actually be a stand because parts were missing or was just garbage. Guys, this is a stand. It works as expected and actually looks very nice with a pair of DT 990's on them. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Works fine as long as you don't mess with it
customer_reviews.text: (This review is for the silicone stand, which I have been told has been improved from the time of this review.) The headphone cradle at the top is held in place with adhesive strips (no, really) and often comes apart. Works fine as long as you don't mess with it. Still, buy a different one, maybe one that isn't held together with tape.
customer_reviews.author: Llama

customer_reviews.title: Good stand but....
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, esthetically pleasing. It's has two thin rubber parts: one for the top part that has a sticker to stick it on and the second as a base that connect to a thin L shaped "steel" bar. It hasn't tipped over and it doesn't take up too much space. But I felt like I over paid for it. I was under the impression that it was solid and heavy which it is not. It's just stable and light which is not a bad thing nor is it a bad stand just a little pricey for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: J.T Mutt

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Looks nice, sturdy and I don't fear it'll topple over or anything like that. Looks nice and subtle so its not a distraction on my desk (it's just a headphone hold afterall). Only con I have to say is the bottom rubber part installs a little funky, and it seems like it's not on correctly, but once it's on and settles it seems good.
customer_reviews.author: GregBoz

customer_reviews.title: Great headset stand
customer_reviews.text: Nice very sturdy design. Great for my corsair void headset. The holder has a nice leaning tilt to it that centers the weight of my headphones perfectly over the base so it does not tip easily. The silicone headphone holder is a nice touch too because it wont gouge the headset band nor does it leave a impression in the padding because it conforms to the shape of the band
customer_reviews.author: Mr._danman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I use these for the SONY MDR-Z1R, $2300 headphones. They just barely fit, with about a centimeter of clearance between the bottoms. I wish the edges on the tray were a little lower. They push up on the cables, bending them a little. The top part has a silicone cover which is good so headphones with leather headbands don't get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Gift for gamer
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my BF for his Xbox One headset because he'd leave it laying around everywhere. He really likes using the stand due to it being very accessible. Tricked him into being more organized! :)
customer_reviews.author: Invictus

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect
customer_reviews.text: The rubber material used feels nice and sturdy. Once connected to the metal frame it doesn't move at all. I put my headphones on them and it does a great job at holding them. I love the space to out the wire so its not all over the table. When you clam the both rubber pieces to the metal you hear a click so you know it will stay.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lopez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and convenient for coiled cables
customer_reviews.text: I prefer coiled cables on my headphones, and they can be hard to keep tidy. This stand is perfect for holding my headphones and coiled cables. I found that the cheaper acrylic "omega" shaped headphone left indents on the pads because it isn't wide enough for the pad to sit fully on the stand. I have two of these now, and I'll always buy one with any set of headphones I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very well put together
customer_reviews.text: Bought this head set holder for my son. He has a set of heavy Logitech G230 Headphones. The build on the stand is very nice. its strong and has a very smart assembly. Only thing I would change is a heavier base to keep the stand with headphone from falling over if nudged. I would buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: David Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Gamer Stand
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this stand. Keeps her gamer headset off the floor or tossed on the desk. Her gaming area now looks neat and tidy. She loves that the stand helps keep her headset from having compressed areas on the foam/vinyl ear covers. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn F

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of flimsy and the base never sits fully flush with the table surface, but otherwise it looks super good! Holds my AKG K553 Pro's easily and it looks VERY tidy with the cable wrapped up in the little tray. However, if you were to just kind of throw the cable onto the tray in a messy ball I can see how it wouldn't fit. Short version: Pretty nice but kinda flimsy and the bottom hovers.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Looks exactly like advertised and works just fine. Only complaint I have is that the piece to hold the headset should be a bit wider and that the base could be heavier. Also some sort of small clip or attachment for better cord management would be nice. Other than that its a great product for 15-18 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: nada

customer_reviews.title: Cheap But Made Well
customer_reviews.text: I first started looking for a new headset holder when I purchased a new set of headphones for gaming and realized a banana hanger wasn't going to cut it anymore. I choose this headset stand as a cheaper alternative to Razer's and I am not disappointed. The assembly was incredibly easy and the design works really well. It has padding on the bottom of the metal piece to insure safety for whatever surface it's placed on. I'm very pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommended
customer_reviews.text: I got so tired of my boyfriend leaving his headphones everywhere. He’s left them under a blanket on the couch before and I have sat on them... This gives him a place to put them when he is done with them, and prevents damage happening from laziness
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a great stand. The black is soft, smooth tpu-like which is great for the surfaces contacting the headset. The silver is steel giving it some heft and making it unlikely to tip easily. It's on of the few stands that has a larger rest area for the headset, which I really liked so the band padding does get super compressed in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: like in many open design headphones including hd800s
customer_reviews.text: not well suited for large headphones. I have a Senn HD800s. The stand is short and may cause damage to the cables going to the connectors if the headphones are not carefully placed on the stand. If the ear pads of the headphones are large, like in many open design headphones including hd800s, the edges of the stand impose pressure on them. This is due to the particular design of the stand and the fact that it's not really designed for large headphones.
customer_reviews.author: jalil taghia

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: So nice. I was happy to have seen this. I ordered it right away. When I charged my headphones, I would have to put hang my headphones over my lampshade and not use that light so I wouldn't burn/melt the padding on my headphones. With the stand it is so nice to be able to hang them without any worries.
customer_reviews.author: Loopy

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Combination of Rubber and Metal
customer_reviews.text: I was getting tired of leaving my headset on my desk and this works nicely. Even at full extension, a Logitech G633 still doesn't touch the bottom. The metal for the stand is a nice touch, as I can't stand plastic, and the rubber top and bottom make nice touches to ensure nothing moves around.
customer_reviews.author: Nero

customer_reviews.title: Stable good stand for protecting the top band
customer_reviews.text: Such a good material and stable stand fit my Sennheiser GAME ZERO . pros. - Easy installation - "My best Pros." Wide soft rubber top part to protect the leather from scratching and doesn't leave it's mark on the memory foam of the headphone top band. and it has a clip which make it stick and does't fall with headphone placement - The height is good and enough to keep the headphone hanging with out touching the bottom part - stable cons. - for me it fits my need as i really desired :D so i can't find any con's so far
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Serag

customer_reviews.title: (-3 stars for the weak base which in picture looks like a good stable stand)
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my friend, but was dissapointed with the construction. The bottom part isn't very stable, and is literally a rubber circle that surrounds a very skinny piece of metal so tends to not stand up solidly as I expected from the picture. For the price I guess its somewhat how i expected and to be fair the guy I bought it for still uses it, but the pictures are misleading, wish they would've shown me the bottom of the stand. (-3 stars for the weak base which in picture looks like a good stable stand)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not as sturdy as I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: It is a fine headphone stand and looks nice however it did not have a large base. There is just a rectangular piece of the aluminum running adjacent to the stand itself. The big circular piece at the bottom is just a rubber mat that covers up the metal strip. Overall it works fine I just wish it was harder to knock over.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Clark

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this headphone stand. Nothing cheap about it. Package well and professionally. Arrived promptly. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Search Alot

customer_reviews.title: Good stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly like you think it does. It holds heavy headphones just fine, and has a small shallow area under that for the cord to collect. It would have been cool if the bottom area were a bit deeper with higher edges so the cord would stay in
customer_reviews.author: Alan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and the price is obviously on the lower side. I have a lite pair of headphones on them and they look good together and I've had no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand is very close to flawless. The metal is very strong, not cheap at all. The rubber piece on top is a heavy duty rubber that firms to the curve of the headphones. My ONLY gripe is the bottom rubber piece fit like 95% perfect. It’s very minor, But I still love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price! Sturdy and nice looking!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old uses this for her Logitech headset. It is inexpensive so I bought two - one for my house and one for her dad’s house. That’s how good it is. Sturdy, stays in place and holds probably any type/brand of headset.
customer_reviews.author: Charisse

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: A very good headphone stand that fits anywhere nicely on a desk or nightstand. It looks great and keeps your headphone cable conveniently coiled underneath.
customer_reviews.author: MrFreecam

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this headphone stand as a birthday gift for my brother after having mine for almost two years. The stand works great and needs a lot of push to tip over. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: I like it especially for the price. It holds my headphones well makes my desk look good. Only one complaint the base is too light can topple over if your not careful about it. But it won’t break, the construction is good.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed and Well Constructed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase and I am very happy with this product. The base is perfect for storing wires (if necessary) and the headband support flexes just enough to avoid creasing the padding.
customer_reviews.author: John Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great quality headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great headphone stand. Not only is design one of the best but the quality and feel of the material is top notch. I like the base portion which allows for things like the cable or any accessory to stored. Not many headphone stands have this option. I own two the stands and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

product_meta.title: Avantree Aluminum Metal Headphone Stand Hanger with Cable Holder, Black Desk Earphone Mount Rack for Sennheiser, Sony, Bose, Beats Gaming Headset Display, Fancy Music Studio Accessories - HS102
feature_bullets: SLEEK, SIMPLE & SPACE SAVING: Our unique stylish design features a silicone top pad and sturdy solid steel construction to provide a stable foundation for your headphones - and clear some space on your desk.
STABLE & ANTI SLIP: Featuring a silicone cable holder at the bottom, our headset holder can also hold your phone in a variety of positions without scratching or damaging your device.
PERSONAL & PROFESSIONAL: Whether you use on your desk at work or near your gaming console at home, our headphone hanger is perfect for keeping your favorite headphones in perfect condition.

CONVENIENT & COMPATIBLE: Perfect for headsets measuring 4cm at the headband and 25cm tall, our headset hanger is compatible with major brands including Sennheiser, Sony, Audio-Technica, Bose, Beats & AKG.

CUSTOMERS SAY: “I bought a second stand as soon as I opened the first!” | “Best headset stand I have found thus far!” Avantree offers you a way to keep your headphones in pristine condition. With our 2 year warranty, you can purchase our headset stand worry free!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,106 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
